borrow.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to use something that belongs to someone else and that you must give back to them later
borrow.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Can I borrow your pen for a minute?
They borrowed heavily  (=borrowed a lot of money) from the bank to start their new business.
You are allowed to borrow six books from the library at a time.
borrow.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to take or copy someone’s ideas, words etc and use them in your own work, language etc
borrow.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: To borrow a phrase  (=use what someone else has said), if you can’t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen.
I borrowed my ideas from Eliot’s famous poem ‘The Waste Land’.
English has borrowed words from many languages.
borrow.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to receive money from a person or organization which you must pay back later
borrow.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Nowhere else in Europe can home-buyers borrow 100% of the purchase price.
Your business can borrow money from your pension fund on normal commercial terms.
